alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hunterdon, north central Mercer, Somerset and northern Middlesex Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Skillman, or 12 miles southwest of Somerville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Middlesex, Bound Brook, Manville, Flemington, Hopewell, Rocky Hill, Millstone, Skillman, Flagtown, Colonia and Belle Mead. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 41 and 43. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 17. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 123 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, northern and northwestern New Jersey.
